availableEntities: Civil conflicts with foreign state intervention

title: Non-state and state-based conflicts
subtitle: Ongoing conflicts are represented for every year in which they resulted in at least 25 battle-related deaths. State-based conflict is between at least two named organisations, where at least one was the government of a state. Non-state conflict is between two named non-state organisations. One-sided violence is that between a named organisation and civilians, such as genocides.

relatedQuestions.text: Counting world conflict deaths: why do sources differ?
